utterance.content: No.

utterance.content: Yeah. You want to be kidnapped and interrogated? They got a package. You want to be a super spy? They got a package. Their motto is "authenticity."

utterance.content: All right, find out who the hell's in charge. Let's see if "authenticity" includes murder.

utterance.content: She's persistent, I'll give her that.

utterance.content: No! No! Ha-ha. No, no, no.

utterance.content: All right.

utterance.content: Ah. Does the reemergence of summer hats mean you'll be making an appearance in the Hamptons?

utterance.content: Fantastic! Ha-ha! I'm so proud!

utterance.content: I'll be fine. I'll finish the book.

utterance.content: Good.

utterance.content: Nice to meet you.

utterance.content: Hey, sorry about that.

utterance.content: How old would you say that kid is?

utterance.content: Old enough to do all the things you did when you were his age.

utterance.content: That's what I'm afraid of.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE

utterance.speaker: LIZ FENN
utterance.content: That's Roger Farraday. He was on the four day covert ops package culminating in a staged assassination of a UN diplomat.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Stamford, Connecticut. He lists his wife as Melinda as his emergency contact.

utterance.speaker: JASON FENN
utterance.content: Detective, we're very sorry about the confusion. We called as soon as we got your messages.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So the fake IDs, the Cayman Islands...

utterance.speaker: JASON FENN
utterance.content: Yeah, they're all part of the experience.

utterance.speaker: LIZ FENN
utterance.content: You have no idea how excited people get when they have to wire their payment to an offshore account.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So your slogan is "authenticity." Is it possible one of your other players took things too far?

utterance.speaker: JASON FENN
utterance.content: Mr. Castle, we take the safety of our guests very seriously. Our weapons look real, but they're legal, inoperable, and rigged for game play. So if one of the guests killed Roger, they used their own weapon, not ours.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So the weapons are fake, but the money is real?

utterance.speaker: LIZ FENN
utterance.content: What money?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The 5,000 Euros we found in the car.

utterance.speaker: JASON FENN
utterance.content: Uh, yeah, we-- we do money drops sometimes, but never with real currency.

utterance.speaker: LIZ FENN
utterance.content: That's more than he paid for his package. Are you sure it was real?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Positive. What was Mr. Farraday doing in the park that night? Was that a part of a mission?

utterance.speaker: JASON FENN
utterance.content: No, no, no. The park is too dangerous to work at night. And his last mission should've ended hours earlier.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What was his last mission?

utterance.speaker: HUGO MORRISON
utterance.content: Farraday? Yeah, I was his handler. His last mission that day was the bus locker drop. I checked it at ten, it was empty. So we know he picked up the pen.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The one with the recording?

utterance.speaker: HUGO MORRISON
utterance.content: Yeah. His next activity was the cafe meet yesterday.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So where did he go between ten and midnight?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And how did he end up in the park with 5,000 Euros in his car?

utterance.speaker: JASON FENN
utterance.content: Wasn't his last drop an accomplice mission?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: An accomplice mission?

utterance.speaker: LIZ FENN
utterance.content: Well, sometimes we have players do tasks together, not knowing if the other is friend or foe.

utterance.speaker: JASON FENN
utterance.content: He was paired with Designate 145, French Intelligence.

utterance.speaker: LIZ FENN
utterance.content: Andrea Fisher. If she was with him, maybe she knows where he went next.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Recognize her?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mais, oui.

utterance.speaker: ANDREA FISHER
utterance.content: Oh, God. You both must think I'm so stupid, the way that I acted in the cafe.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All part of the game.

utterance.speaker: ANDREA FISHER
utterance.content: It's a vacation from yourself. That's what they say. I mean, don't get me wrong. You know, I loved my husband and my kids, but every time I go away, I'm still a mom and a wife. My husband said, "If you can pay for it, you can go." so, it took a lot of coupon clipping, but I got to be a spy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Our victim, how well did you know him?

utterance.speaker: ANDREA FISHER
utterance.content: We had a couple of tasks together, but-- but we were always playing roles.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You were with Mr. Farraday when he did the bus station drop?

utterance.speaker: ANDREA FISHER
utterance.content: Yeah. Yeah, we, uh, we cracked the code, and um, we went to-- to get our packages.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you know where he went next?

utterance.speaker: ANDREA FISHER
utterance.content: To deliver the briefcase.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Briefcase? What briefcase?

utterance.speaker: ANDREA FISHER
utterance.content: It was in the locker. I didn't get one, so I assumed it was a bonus mission.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you know what was in the briefcase?

utterance.speaker: ANDREA FISHER
utterance.content: I-- I don't know. You have to ask them.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That was Jason from Spy Ventures. The only thing that was supposed to be in that locker was a pen set, which he put in there himself. He has no idea where that briefcase came from.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If the money and the briefcase weren't connected to the game, maybe they're connected to each other.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. Victim's wife and business partner. They just ID'd the body.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can you check the lockers at the bus depot, see if they're covered by cameras?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, sure.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Please take a seat.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We can't be sure that your husband's death had anything to do with the game, Mrs. Farraday.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Can you think of a reason someone would want to harm Roger?

utterance.speaker: LEE COPELY
utterance.content: Roger was one of those guys everybody instantly liked. That's why he was so good at his job. We owned a dealership together just outside Stamford. You can't sell cars if people don't like you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who else knew that he was gonna be in the city?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, it used to be if you were gonna have a midlife crisis, you'd just buy a Ferrari, get a new girlfriend, even jump out of a plane.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Shot in the park, money in his car. Makes you wonder what else he did to get his jollies.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Now that we know who he really is, I've asked Esposito to look into his financials. Maybe we'll see a red flag somewhere.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Speaking of red flags. Hey, Demming.

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: Hey, Castle. So, you know that little place in Asbury I was telling you about, around the corner from our beach house?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mm-hmm.

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: Well, they just had a reservation open up on Friday. If we leave early enough, we could probably make it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, um, will you let me check into it?

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: Great. I'll see you later.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beach house? Thought you were working this weekend.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I'm sorry, Castle. I should've just told you. I just didn't want things to be awkward between us, now that Tom and I are together.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, I get it. Yeah. No, you want your private life to be private.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I just don't-- I don't want anyone to feel uncomfortable.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, of course not. No, I mean... Actually, that makes what I was gonna say a little easier. Um... What with my book due, I was thinking it'd be a good time for us to take a break.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A break?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. God knows, you got to be tired of me following you around all the time, and I really do need to get some work done. With everyone gone, I figured, why not just stay up in the Hamptons, you know? Get away from the city for a while.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, for how long?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The summer at least. I thought this would be our last case.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. So, uh, we...

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Everything okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Great.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, fine. Uh, what'd you guys find?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Surveillance stills from the bus locker. Your long Island housewife was right. Roger picked up the briefcase from locker 27B shortly before 10 p.m.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Great.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You don't want to know who put it in there?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh. Yeah, I'm sorry. Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That's Roger's handler from Spy Ventures. He said the briefcase wasn't part of the game, so why is he putting it in Roger's locker?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And why did he lie?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Exactly.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What was in the briefcase, Hugo?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We talked to your bosses, Hugo. We know it wasn't part of the game.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And yet you had one of your players pick it up and deliver it for you. And he just happened to end up dead.

utterance.speaker: HUGO MORRISON
utterance.content: I didn't know.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You didn't know what?

utterance.speaker: HUGO MORRISON
utterance.content: Look, no one was supposed to get hurt. I just... I needed someone to make the exchange.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What was in the briefcase, Hugo? Drugs? Money?

utterance.speaker: HUGO MORRISON
utterance.content: IDs.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: IDs?

utterance.speaker: HUGO MORRISON
utterance.content: Part of my job is to make the ID kits. Corporate badges, passports from nonexistent countries. But with Jason's equipment, you can forge counterfeit IDs for real countries, too. But it's illegal.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But that didn't stop you, did it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So who did you sell to?

utterance.speaker: HUGO MORRISON
utterance.content: College kids, mostly looking to buy beer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And then you used game players to make the drops?

utterance.speaker: HUGO MORRISON
utterance.content: So if anybody got busted, they couldn't identify me. I mean, these are college kids. They'd roll over on their grandmothers if they got caught.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, something tells me that Roger wasn't killed by a group of under-aged college kids.

utterance.speaker: HUGO MORRISON
utterance.content: No. This last job, it was different. I knew I shouldn't have taken it, but they were paying so much money.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: HUGO MORRISON
utterance.content: They're Ukrainians. They found me on the internet. They said they needed passports. I sent Roger to make the drop and pick up the money.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: 5,000 Euros.

utterance.speaker: HUGO MORRISON
utterance.content: He thought it was just another mission. But something must have gone wrong. After he made the drop, he called me on the hotline, said he was being followed by a dark sedan.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A dark sedan? And what time was this?

utterance.speaker: HUGO MORRISON
utterance.content: 11:30-ish. Look, playing the game, it makes you paranoid. So I just-- I figured it was just his imagination. So I gave him the standard line about evasive maneuvers. I didn't really think he was being followed. But he was. He called again close to midnight and said his cover had been blown. I thought he was messing with me, so I shined him on. Shined him on, and now he's dead. I must have done something wrong. Must have messed up the passports... And they came after him and they killed him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The briefcase, where did he deliver it to? Hugo, the Ukrainians, I need an address now.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Clear!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Turn 'em around!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Kids.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yep, they're Ukrainians, but they're students. They're used to being able to drink back home, but they needed fake IDs to buy booze here. They got Hugo's information from another kid in the summer program.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Summer program?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, they're part of the summer exchange program at Hudson University. Why?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No reason.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Anyway, none of them own a dark sedan. And seeing as how they all went out partying the moment Roger dropped off the IDs, it's doubtful any of them are our killer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You actually think he was being followed?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, he calls at 11:30, and then just before he's shot, his car is damaged. He runs on foot into the park. Sounds to me like he was running away. But from whom?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, as much as I'd like to help you run down every dark sedan in the city, I have a poker game to host. See you in the morning.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: See you.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So...Castle's last case, huh?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mm-hmm.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ryan and I thought we'd do a little going away party.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, well, it's not like he's leaving forever.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You sure about that? Why do you think he's been following you around all this time? What, research? The guy's done enough research to write 50 books. Look, whatever the reason is, I'm pretty sure it doesn't include watching you be with another guy.

utterance.speaker: MICHAEL CONNELLY
utterance.content: The Ukrainians are a nice twist.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, we've explained the money, the gadgets and the briefcase. The only thing we can't explain, why was he killed?

utterance.speaker: JAMES PATTERSON
utterance.content: Maybe that's because you're looking in the wrong place.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right, Patterson, where would you look?

utterance.speaker: JAMES PATTERSON
utterance.content: If I was writing this, the murder would have nothing to do with the spy game, except that it gave the killer an opportunity to act.

utterance.speaker: MICHAEL CONNELLY
utterance.content: Knowing that the trappings of the game would cover his tracks.

utterance.speaker: MICHAEL CONNELLY
utterance.content: Cannell's right. I'd spend more time looking at your victim and less time looking at the game.

utterance.speaker: JAMES PATTERSON
utterance.content: Personally, I'd spend more time writing and less time hanging out with your cop friend. I mean, really, Ricky. Just one book a year?

utterance.speaker: JAMES PATTERSON
utterance.content: She seems like more of a distraction than a muse.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, you're right. I think I've gotten everything I can get out of that relationship anyway.

utterance.speaker: DEMMING
utterance.content: Hey, you ready?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh... I was just thinking. May...

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I've been thinking...

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe we're looking in the wrong place. Maybe the murder has nothing to do with the game. Maybe it just afforded the killer an opportunity to act.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That's so funny, because I was thinking the same thing when I woke up this morning, that maybe we got so caught up in the game that we stopped looking at what really mattered.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The victim.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Exactly. So, check this out. His financials came back clean. But then we did a search on his business partner, Lee Copley, and it turns out that he filed for bankruptcy two months ago. Overextended himself in real estate.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Let me guess, if Roger dies, his half of the business goes to Copley.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Over half a million dollars worth.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: His wife did say the only two people who knew Roger was in the city were her and Copley.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And guess what Copley drives.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A dark sedan?

utterance.speaker: LEE COPLEY
utterance.content: Roger was my friend. We grew up together. Why would I kill him?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I can give you half a million reasons why.

utterance.speaker: LEE COPLEY
utterance.content: What, because I'm having financial problems? Because we just happen to own a business together?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Greed, Mr. Copley, it's the purest motive there is.

utterance.speaker: LEE COPLEY
utterance.content: This is ridiculous.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where were you the night that Roger Farraday was murdered?

utterance.speaker: LEE COPLEY
utterance.content: I was home in bed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really? Then do you care to explain these? These are photos of you leaving your apartment garage at eight o'clock the night that he was murdered. And these are photos of you returning the following morning at 7 a.m.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Kind of blows a hole in your whole "home in bed" thing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You lied to me, Mr. Copely. Do you care to revise your statement? 8 p.m. That's plenty of time to drive to the city from Stamford.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What'd you do, Lee? Wait for him at the hotel, follow him till he was alone?

utterance.speaker: LEE COPLEY
utterance.content: No, I didn't.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And then you used the game as cover.

utterance.speaker: LEE COPLEY
utterance.content: No. Look, I swear, I didn't do it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Right. You were at home in bed.

utterance.speaker: LEE COPLEY
utterance.content: No, I wasn't at home, but I was in bed. With his wife.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I'm sorry. What?

utterance.speaker: LEE COPLEY
utterance.content: I was in bed with Roger's wife.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Let me-- Let me get this straight. You-- your alibi for killing your friend is you were doing his-- his wife?

utterance.speaker: LEE COPLEY
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wow.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, if things were that bad, why not just get a divorce?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I can see why Roger needed a little extra fantasy in his life.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I talked to the wife's neighbors. A few of them remember Lee's car outside the house that night.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That doesn't mean anything. The guy runs an auto dealership. Could have just switched cars.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: True, except it was a warm night. Warm enough to leave the windows open.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, no.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, yes. The next door neighbor distinctly remembers hearing the sounds of loud, passionate lovemaking coming from the open bedroom window. Kept him up till well past midnight.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don't buy it. They both had motive. They were having an affair. They knew exactly where he was. Just because they had an alibi does not mean they didn't do it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you think they hired someone?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It had all the hallmarks of a professional hit.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, it couldn't have been Lee unless he asked the bankruptcy court for permission to hire a hit man, and I don't think that's likely.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And the only unusual charge in the Farradays' account was the ten grand that Roger wired to the Spy Ventures account in the Cayman Islands.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ten grand?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, why?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because he only should've paid half that much. Do you remember what the woman at Spy Ventures said about the money we found in the car?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, that 5,000 Euros was more than what he paid for his entire spy-cation.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: His bank statement indicates he transferred two payments of five grand each to the game, for a total of $10,000.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The payments were made at the same time, almost like he paid twice.

utterance.speaker: JASON FENN
utterance.content: If these numbers are correct, he did pay twice. Once for him, once for another player.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Another player?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who was the other player?

utterance.speaker: JASON FENN
utterance.content: Andrea Fisher.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Our Long Island housewife? She said she never met Roger until they were teamed up for the game.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But if they never met, why did he pay for her?

utterance.speaker: ANDREA FISHER
utterance.content: There must be some mistake.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We checked with the bank, Mrs. Fisher. There is no mistake. You never paid Spy Ventures.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But Roger did. The coupon clipping was a nice touch, though. I assume that was for your husband's benefit?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What was the nature of your relationship with Roger Farraday?

utterance.speaker: ANDREA FISHER
utterance.content: We were, um, friends.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When did the two of you first meet?

utterance.speaker: ANDREA FISHER
utterance.content: Last year. I was, uh, I was taking my daughter Shelby into, uh, the city for dance classes. After I dropped her off, I'd go to the museum. Every week, I'd see him, standing in front of Monet's Water Lilies. You know, for an hour, it wasn't, "Mommy, can you do this?" or "Honey, can you do that?" You know? I was me. Oh, God. After a few weeks, the museum turned into a hotel. And then Shelby's dance classes ended.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You had no excuse to go into the city anymore.

utterance.speaker: ANDREA FISHER
utterance.content: When we first met, we pretended to be spies, exchanging secrets at the museum. Roger thought, "Why not have a real-life spy adventure?" And we could have one last time together.

utterance.speaker: KEN FISHER
utterance.content: Hey, hon, I'm back.

utterance.speaker: ANDREA FISHER
utterance.content: Oh, my God. Please don't tell my husband.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We don't have to, Mrs. Fisher. He already knows.

utterance.speaker: KEN FISHER
utterance.content: What's going on?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Fisher, I'm Detective Kate Beckett. NYPD.

utterance.speaker: KEN FISHER
utterance.content: What's this about?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You own a black 2009 four-door sedan?

utterance.speaker: KEN FISHER
utterance.content: Yeah, why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where is it?

utterance.speaker: KEN FISHER
utterance.content: It's in the shop. I hit a pole while I was backing out at the supermarket.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You're a much better shot than you are a liar.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The state of New York lists you as a registered gun owner, Glock .45.

utterance.speaker: ANDREA FISHER
utterance.content: Oh, my God. Oh, my God. What did you do to him?

utterance.speaker: KEN FISHER
utterance.content: What he deserved.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: So Roger was right about being followed that night.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, when the husband got on to the affair, he did a little spy game of his own. Tracked down and killed his wife's lover.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Mmm. Two affairs, a loveless marriage. It's sad a man had to die because all the people involved were too scared to say what they really felt.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, it is sad.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And how many shows like that? Sure. Make it two, and you got a deal. All right. Hey, I gotta run. I gotta drive Alexis to Princeton. But I will be back in time for that little surprise party the boys are throwing for me... What? What?
